entry.title: The Sudan (United Nations Measures) (Isle of Man) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order, made under the United Nations Act 1946, implements in part, in the Isle of Man, Resolution 1591 (2005) adopted by the Security Council of the United Nations on 29th March 2005

entry.title: The Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005 (Commencement No. 1, Transitional and Transitory Provisions) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order brings into force provisions of the Serious Organised Crime and Police Act 2005. The provisions specified in articles 2 and 3 are brought into force on 1st July 2005, subject to transitional and transitory provisions. Those specified in article 4 are brought into force on 1st August 2005 (subject to a transitory provision) and those specified in article 5 are brought into force on 1st April 2006.

entry.title: The Electricity and Gas (Determination of Turnover for Penalties) Order (Northern Ireland) 2005
entry.summary: Article 45 of the Energy (Northern Ireland) Order 2003 (“the Energy Order”) provides that where the Northern Ireland Authority for Energy Regulation (“the Authority”) is satisfied that –

entry.title: The Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (Regulated Activities) (Amendment) (No.2) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order amends the Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (Regulated Activities) Order 2001 (S.I. 2001/544) (“the Regulated Activities Order).

entry.title: The Fire (Charging) (Scotland) Order 2005
entry.summary: Section 16 of the Fire (Scotland) Act 2005 (asp 5) provides that Scottish Ministers may, by order, authorise a relevant authority to charge a person of a specified description for any action of a specified description taken by the authority. (“Relevant authority” has the same meaning as at section 6 of the Fire (Scotland) Act 2005). Article 2 and the Schedule to this Order specify the actions for which a relevant authority may make a charge and specify the description of the persons who may be subject to the charge.

entry.title: The Democratic Republic of the Congo (United Nations Sanctions) (Isle of Man) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order, made under the United Nations Act 1946, applies to the Isle of Man and gives effect, in part, to Resolution 1596 (2005) adopted by the Security Council of the United Nations on 18th April 2005.

entry.title: The Kava-kava in Food Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations revoke and replace the Kava-kava in Food Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003.

entry.title: The Sudan (United Nations Measures) (Channel Islands) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order, made under the United Nations Act 1946, implements, in part, in the Channel Islands, Resolution 1591 (2005) adopted by the Security Council of the United Nations on 29th March 2005.

entry.title: The Regulation of Care (Social Service Workers) (Scotland) Order 2005
entry.summary: Section 44(1) of the Regulation of Care (Scotland) Act 2001 (2001 asp 8) (“the Act”) requires the Scottish Social Services Council to maintain a register of social workers, social service workers of any other description prescribed and persons participating in a course or employed in a position probationary to becoming either a social worker or social service worker of a qualified description.

entry.title: The Fire (Additional Function) (Scotland) Order 2005
entry.summary: The functions of fire and rescue authorities and joint fire and rescue boards (together defined as “relevant authorities” in section 6 of the Fire (Scotland) Act 2005 (asp 5) (“the 2005 Act”)) are set out in sections 8 to 11 of the 2005 Act.

entry.title: The Naval, Military and Air Forces Etc. (Disablement and Death) Service Pensions (Amendment) (No.2) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order amends the Naval, Military and Air Forces Etc. (Disablement and Death) Service Pensions Order 1983 (“the principal Order”) which makes provision for pensions and other awards in respect of disablement or death due to service in the naval, military and air forces.

title.div: The National Assembly for Wales (Social Services Explanations) Regulations 2005 / Rheoliadau Cynulliad Cenedlaethol Cymru (Esboniadau ynghylch Gwasanaethau Cymdeithasol) 2005

div.p: These Regulations permit the National Assembly for Wales to require any person listed in regulation 2(3) to provide an explanation to the Assembly of any thing listed in regulation 2(1), for example a document removed from premises by a authorised Assembly inspector under section 99 of the Health and Social Care (Community Health and Standards) Act 2003 (“the 2003 Act”).

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn caniatáu i Gynulliad Cenedlaethol Cymru ei gwneud yn ofynnol i unrhyw berson a restrir yn rheoliad 2(3) roi esboniad i'r Cynulliad am unrhyw beth a restrir yn rheoliad 2(1), er enghraifft dogfen a gymerwyd o fangre gan un o arolygwyr awdurdodedig y Cynulliad o dan adran 99 o Ddeddf Iechyd a Gofal Cymdeithasol (Iechyd Cymunedol a Safonau) 2003 (“Deddf 2003”).

entry.title: The Local Government Pension Scheme (Scotland) Amendment (No. 2) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations make amendments to the Local Government Pension Scheme (Scotland) Regulations 1998 (“the principal Regulations”) which are necessary as a result of the dissolution of Scottish Homes.

entry.title: The Products of Animal Origin (Third Country Imports) (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Products of Animal Origin (Third Country Imports) (Scotland) Regulations 2002 (S.S.I. 2002/445) which implement Council Directive 97/78/EC laying down the principles governing the organisation of veterinary checks on products entering the Community from third countries (O.J. No. L 24, 30.1.1998, p.9).

entry.title: The Consular Fees Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order revokes and replaces the Consular Fees Order (No 2) 1999.

entry.title: The Non-Domestic Rating (Valuation of Utilities) (Scotland) Amendment Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order amends the Non-Domestic Rating (Valuation of Utilities) (Scotland) Order 2005 (“the 2005 Order”) and comes into force on 1st July 2005.

entry.title: The Insolvency (Northern Ireland) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order amends the Insolvency (Northern Ireland) Order 1989 and makes other provision about insolvency.

entry.title: The Fire (Scotland) Act 2005 (Consequential Modifications and Amendments) (No. 2) Order 2005
entry.summary: This Order makes amendments to and revokes provisions in subordinate legislation. These amendments and revocations are consequential for the purposes of, or in consequence of, the Fire (Scotland) Act 2005, asp 5 (“the 2005 Act”). The effect of the subordinate legislation has not been altered; however, the terminology used in the subordinate legislation is updated.

entry.title: Burma (Financial Sanctions) Regulations 2005
entry.summary: These Regulations provide that breaches of certain provisions of Council Regulation (EC) No 798/2004 of 26th April 2004 (the “EC Regulation”) relating to financial sanctions are criminal offences.

entry.title: The Tax Information Exchange Agreement (Taxes on Income) (Virgin Islands) Order 2005

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Tax Information Exchange Agreement (Taxes on Income) (Virgin Islands) Order 2005

entry.summary: The Tax Information Exchange Agreement between the United Kingdom and the British Virgin Islands (“BVI”) is set out in the Schedule to this Order.
